6/ In short, don’t let someone *tell* you they’re going to be next gen #crypto . Let them *prove* it w/ action & adoption, and manage your position over time based on their thesis & claims playing out (or not).
5/ I worry for people that are looking for the “next #Bitcoin ” or “next #Ethereum ,” and thus buy into rosy pictures painted by teams that will overpromise and underdeliver.

4/ I have no doubt there will be a great amount of innovation w/ new #cryptos , but am immediately skeptical when a project labels itself as “next gen.” It’s like proclaiming oneself to be a genius. Others do that for you.

3/ First thing to check for are the priors of the dev team for said “next gen” #cryptoasset . What qualifies them to do better than the massive brains behind #Bitcoin , #Ethereum , and other predecessors?
1/ Be careful of self-labeled “next gen” #cryptoasets that promise to solve all the problems of their predecessors.
4/ While the first half of 2017 represented a monster leg for $ ETH , the second half has been relatively tame (by 2017 #crypto standards). All eyes on Q1 2018 and Casper.
3/ Will be curious to watch what happens between $ ETH and its siblings if sentiment turns, or #Ethereum gets through its own wall of worry (as #Bitcoin has done in 2017).
2/ there’s also the little explored idea of “market beta” in #crypto . The aforementioned “small caps” anecdotally have higher betas, and so should outperform in a broadly bullish environment
1/ $ ETH competitors (e.g., $ EOS , $ NEO & $ ETC ) have mostly outperformed their elder sibling in this leg of the #crypto bull market, likely due to concerns around #Ethereum scaling.

I back of the enveloped the “speculation multiple” between 2-10x a few months ago, put out a long thread on it then. The math is basically: how many new users per day X average $ buy in per user X number of days. That gives fiat inflow. Anything above is crypto2crypto driven
I try and look at it as a whole for the crypto space, since so many of these assets can only be purchased via $ BTC or $ ETH as the pair (hence it must be crypto2crypto for many assets)

Yes, the question for me has always been how much price appreciation is due to “new fiat” vs “crypto2crypto,” the latter of which can become a house of cards. The amplification of value due to crypto2crypto we could call a “speculation multiple?”
